caption:
This photograph captures three caribou in motion, set against a subdued, natural backdrop that suggests a twilight or dimly lit setting. The caribou are captured in mid-stride, indicating dynamic movement across what appears to be an open, grassy landscape. Each animal has a full set of branching antlers, highlighting their maturity and wild nature.

The background is composed of soft-focused elements that suggest a wide-open space under a possibly overcast sky. The horizon is low, underlining the expanse of the landscape, with a faint hint of a watery or reflective surface in the distance, contributing a sense of depth. The colors are subdued, with hints of greys and greens, enhancing the feeling of dusk or an overcast day.

Overall, the scene communicates a natural and undisturbed wildlife habitat, emphasizing the grace and beauty of these animals in their natural setting.
title: Caribou trot across the tundra, near Prudhoe Bay where the pipeline will start.
